message.content: <local-command-caveat>Caveat: The messages below were generated by the user while running local commands. DO NOT respond to these messages or otherwise consider them in your response unless the user explicitly asks you to.</local-command-caveat>
please make main and develop match. do not lose any work we are in a bad state

content.thinking: Let me understand the current state of the repository. The user wants to make main and develop match without losing any work. Let me first check the current state of the branches.

input.command: git log --oneline -10 origin/main && echo "---DEVELOP---" && git log --oneline -10 origin/develop && echo "---CURRENT BRANCH---" && git branch --show-current
input.description: Check state of main, develop, and current branch

content.text: Let me start by understanding the current state of all branches.

content.text:
Now I understand the situation. Let me analyze:

- **`origin/main`**: at `a5e69dc` — has PRs #35-#40 (restructure, fixes, security)
- **`origin/develop`**: at `a065630` (#42) — has `#36` (markdownlint) + `#42` (CLAUDE.md trim/SKILLS.md) but is **missing** main's commits #35, #37, #38, #39, #40
- **Current branch**: has local uncommitted changes, based on main

The problem: `develop` diverged from `main` and is missing critical commits. I need to bring `develop` up to date with `main` without losing the `develop`-only work (#36 markdownlint, #42 CLAUDE.md trim).

input.command: git log --oneline origin/main..origin/develop && echo "---DEVELOP ONLY---" && git log --oneline origin/develop..origin/main && echo "---MAIN ONLY---"
input.description: Show commits unique to each branch

input.command: git merge-base origin/main origin/develop
input.description: Find common ancestor of main and develop

content.text:
The common ancestor is `6aa3760` (sync develop→main #30). So:
- `develop` has: `cd701d2` (act integration), `08c2c1f` (markdownlint), `a065630` (CLAUDE.md trim) — all develop-only work
- `main` has: `0cbfe7d`, `f059c83`, `26a9df9`, `221483c`, `8d8a21a`, `a5e69dc` — 6 commits develop is missing

The fix: create a merge branch that merges `main` into `develop`, then PR it to `develop`.

content.text: Only one conflict — `CLAUDE.md`. The `develop` branch has the trimmed version (#42), `main` has the older longer version. The develop version is what we want to keep.

content.content:
# WFC — World Fucking Class

Multi-agent code review, planning, and implementation framework for Claude Code.
**Never implement features manually — always use WFC skills.**

===
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code when working with the WFC codebase.

## 🐍 Python Environment Rules

content.text: `develop`'s `CLAUDE.md` is the trimmed version (78 lines, current CLAUDE.md). `main`'s is the old 818-line version. We want to keep `develop`'s trimmed version.

input.command: git checkout --ours CLAUDE.md && git add CLAUDE.md

content.content: Updated 1 path from the index

toolUseResult.stdout: Updated 1 path from the index

input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
chore: sync main → develop (merge 6 commits, keep trimmed CLAUDE.md)

Merges origin/main into develop to bring develop up to date.
Conflict in CLAUDE.md resolved by keeping develop's trimmed version (#42).

Main commits incorporated:
- #40: Workflow permissions fix (code scanning)
- #35: Audit WFC + architectural migration plan
- #38: Deadline enforcement on signature loading
- #37: Installer settings, verbosity, hook python3 command
- #34: Full documentation modernization v2.0
- #33: nektos/act local CI gate

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

content.text: Clean. Now let me verify the state and push.

input.command:
gh pr create --base develop --title "chore: sync main → develop" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

- Merges `origin/main` into `develop` to resolve branch divergence
- Conflict in `CLAUDE.md` resolved by keeping `develop`'s trimmed version (#42)
- No work is lost: all develop-only commits preserved (#36, #42), all main commits incorporated

## Commits from main incorporated

- `#40` Workflow permissions fix (code scanning alert)
- `#35` Audit WFC + architectural migration plan
- `#38` Deadline enforcement on signature loading
- `#37` Installer settings, verbosity, hook python3 command
- `#34` Full documentation modernization v2.0
- `#33` nektos/act local CI gate

## Test plan

- [ ] CI passes on this PR
- [ ] Verify `CLAUDE.md` on develop is the trimmed 78-line version (not the old 818-line version)
- [ ] Verify `wfc/references/SKILLS.md` is present (from #42)

content.text:
Done. Here's the summary:

**What was wrong:**
- `develop` and `main` had diverged since their common ancestor `6aa3760` (#30)
- `develop` was missing 6 commits from `main` (#33, #34, #37, #38, #35, #40)
- `main` was missing 3 commits from `develop` (#32 act integration, #36 markdownlint, #42 CLAUDE.md trim)

**What I did:**
1. Created `claude/sync-main-into-develop-1771560196` from `origin/develop`
2. Merged `origin/main` into it — one conflict in `CLAUDE.md`, resolved by keeping `develop`'s trimmed version
3. Pushed and opened **PR #44** → `develop`
4. Restored your local stashed changes to `claude/trim-claude-md-and-add-skills-ref`

**Next:** Once CI passes on PR #44, merge it. Then `develop` will have everything from `main` plus its own work. After that you can sync `develop → main` to fully align them.
